introduction:
The 'Sensor Modelling and Simulation Lab' deals with working principles, factors governing performance, and identifying static and dynamic characteristics of all major sensors.

The first principle model which is running in the background will represent ideal characteristics. The configurable parameter will give an insight to students about the deviations from standard or expected field application.

experiments.name: Simulate the performance of a bio-sensor
Measurement of level in a tank using capacitive type level probe
Design an orifice plate for a typical application
Simulate the performance of a chemical sensor

UG: Undergraduate students of Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering branches.
PG: Post-graduate students of Process Instrumentation, Mechatronics, Production Engineering.

objective:
1. Characterise the sensor under test
2. Identify and plot the static and dynamic characteristics of the sensor.
3. Select proper material of construction and allied components for specific application of a sensor.

universities: Institute having Instrumentation and control department
